refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Spin uses an optional configuration file spin.conf located at /etc/spin/. The location of this file can be overridden using the -c or --config Spin command line option. The default Spin installation does not include a spin.conf file.

listitem.para: Specifies a directory PATH in which one or more Spin modules can be found. The default is the system path. Multiple path elements are allowed. This element corresponds to the --lib-path command-line option.

Specifies the directory and filename PATH to which Spin writes logging information. The default path is /var/log/spin.log. Spin creates the log file if none exists. This element corresponds to the --log-file command-line option.

Specifies a directory PATH in which one or more of Spin's shared files can be found; the directory contains a hierarchy enabling Spin to extract files for schemas, *.rng, fonts and images. The default path is /usr/share/spin. Multiple path elements are allowed. This element corresponds to the --share-path command-line option .

Specifies a boolean value which enables or disables debug mode in Spin. Enabling debug mode causes exception tracebacks, which are normally hidden, to be displayed on the command line when they occur.

refsect1.title: CACHE ELEMENTS
refsect1.para: Spin caches data across sessions for improved performance. The cache element allows specifying cache-related options.

listitem.para: The path child element specifies where Spin stores both shared and per distribution cache data. The default is /var/cache/spin.

The max-size child element specifies the maximum size for the shared cache located at CACHEDIR/.cache. The shared cache contains a copy of all files downloaded by Spin. There is no human-readable form of the shared cache. The default size is 30GB. The recommended minimum size is 5GB. The default suffix is GB; other common suffixes are MB, GiB and TB.
Spin deletes files from the shared cache on a least-recently used basis.

refsect1.title: VARIABLES
refsect1.para: Spin element values, where indicated, use three variables: CACHEDIR, PATH and TEXT.

listitem.para: CACHEDIR is the directory location where Spin stores shared and per-distribution cache data.
PATH is the local absolute and relative file paths that Spin supports. Spin resolves relative paths from the current working directory.
TEXT is a string value. The description of each element explains that element's expected values or acceptable variations.
